audience.fullpath: Intended Audience :: by End-User Class :: Developers

name: WFS-XForms
short_description:
This project was started some time back with the idea of making available some work that had been done as part of the eMarine Information Infrastructure project at the University of Tasmania. However, getting it ready for public release became a low priority. I am now doing some related work and thinking about picking it up again

The OGC Web Feature Service (WFS) standard provides a generic means of publishing Geographical 'Features'. These WFS are generally consumed by other OGC standard based clients, such as a  Web Map Service (WMS).

The WFS standard provides the ability to create, update and delete individual feature instances using transactional requests. Such a WFS enabled for such transactions is commonly referred to as a 'WFS-T' service. 

This project provides a means to generate a WFS-T browser based client layer as XForms from a data-model schema. As such it provides a cost-effective generic scientific data-management solution, in particular data as XML.
summary: Generate a WFS-T browser user-interface using XForms
